## Grand Canyon

The Grand Canyon is a huge, steep-sided canyon in Arizona, USA, carved by the Colorado River. It's 277 miles long, up to 18 miles wide, and over a mile deep.  It's protected as Grand Canyon National Park and is also on Native American land.

Geologists believe the canyon formed about 5 to 6 million years ago as the Colorado River cut through the rock. People have lived in the area for thousands of years, and the first European to see it was a Spaniard named García López de Cárdenas in 1540.
